byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Moscow, and Stanley Reed from London.
byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and STANLEY REED

abstract: Saudi Arabia and Russia join call for organized effort to freeze oil production in order to calm markets and stop drop in oil prices; shift in stance indicates how steeply prices have fallen, but effort faces challenge of convincing both Iraq and Iran to reduce production and oil exports.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia, Russia, Venezuela and Qatar agreed to hold production steady as a way to bolster energy prices. But they will proceed only if others do.

headline.main: Oil Output Freeze Has a Catch: Attracting OPEC Unity
headline.print_headline: Oil Nations Embracing Plan to Lift Low Prices

snippet: Saudi Arabia, Russia, Venezuela and Qatar agreed to hold production steady as a way to bolster energy prices. But they will proceed only if others do.

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
keywords.name: organizations
